sentences.text: DEAR STOCKHOLDERS:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since the beginning of 2014, Newfield has differentiated itself during a period of low commodity pricesproving our ability to quickly adapt and innovate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock outperformed our energy peers by 89% during this time as investors rewarded liquidity, a valuable derivatives position and a proven management team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We enter 2017 with an improved asset portfolio, better domestic cost structure and a stronger balance sheet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I am pleased to invite you to join us for our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, which will be held at 8:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Daylight Time on May 16, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As in past years, the Annual Meeting will be held online so that all stockholders, regardless of location, can participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By logging in to our webcast, you will be able to hear our presentation, submit questions and vote on all seven proposals to be considered at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan to attend the virtual meeting, we urge you to vote in advance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The attached Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders and Proxy Statement explains how you can vote and participate in the meeting and review the business we plan to conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are mailing to most of our stockholders a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (Notice) rather than full copies of these documents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Offering proxy materials online allows us to provide our stockholders with readily accessible information without the cost or environmental impact of printed materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice explains how to access our 2016 Annual Report, 2017 Proxy Statement and proxy card online, as well as how to request an optional paper copy of these materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stockholders who do not receive a Notice should receive a paper copy of the proxy materials by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LEE K. BOOTHBY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is very important to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to sign and return your proxy card or vote by telephone or Internet as soon as possible so that your shares will be represented and voted at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting instructions appear on page 69.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I hope you are able to join the virtual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thank you for your investment in Newfield Exploration Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LEE K. BOOTHBY Chairman of the Board, President and CEO

sentences.text: FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of the amounts set forth in this Proxy Statement in the disclosure regarding executive compensation are forward-looking statements within the meaning of the federal securities laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These statements include estimates of future amounts payable under awards, plans and agreements or the present value of future amounts, as well as the estimated value at December 31, 2016, of awards that may vest based on future performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Estimating future payments is necessarily subject to contingencies and uncertainties, many of which are difficult to predict.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to estimate future payments, we make assumptions as to a number of variables, which may, and in many cases will, differ from future actual conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These variables include the price of our common stock, the date of termination of employment, final pay, interest rates, applicable tax rates and other assumptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, amounts and awards paid out in future periods may vary from the related estimates and values set forth in this Proxy Statement.

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Stockholder Return (TSR) Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following a five-year period (2010-2014) of exceptional strength and consistency, crude oil prices began collapsing in late 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The price of oil (NYMEX WTI) reached a low of approximately $26 per barrel in February 2016, as compared to approximately $107 per barrel in mid-2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Natural gas prices also experienced significant declines in 2014-2016, as the NYMEX Henry Hub natural gas price during that period ranged from a high of approximately $6.15 per MMBtu in February 2014 to a low of approximately $1.64 per MMBtu in March 2016 (the lowest price since February 1999).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Despite these significant challenges, we excelled on TSR performance over the past three years versus a group of our peers in the E&P industry that we are likely to be compared against (the E&P Peer Group).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our strong balance sheet, operational execution, timely acquisitions and divestitures and the continued positive results in SCOOP and STACK have helped to differentiate our story from our peers in the E&P Peer Group during this period of commodity price downturn.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we had a gain in TSR of approximately 64% over the past three years ending December 31, 2016, versus an average decline of approximately 25% in the E&P Peer Group in the same period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Relative TSR Performance  3 Year chart below compares our TSR to the E&P Peer Group and highlights our exceptional performance over the past three years:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1: Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How Nominees Are Selected
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted Director Selection Process and Guidelines that establish criteria for nominating, screening and evaluating director candidates and nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee (the Governance Committee) recommends director nominees for approval by the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee considers candidates suggested by its members, other directors, senior management and stockholders in anticipation of upcoming director elections and actual or expected Board vacancies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee is authorized, at Newfields expense, to retain search firms, consultants, and any other advisers it deems appropriate to identify and screen potential candidates, including those nominated or recommended by its members, other directors, senior management and stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee reviews the size and structure of the Board and considers director tenure, skills and experience in determining the slate of nominees and as part of director succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When evaluating candidates, the Governance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) considers the general needs of the Board and Newfield;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) consults with the Chairman, President and CEO, Lead Director, other Board members and key members of senior management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) considers the results of recent Board and Governance Committee self-evaluations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) identifies needed skill sets due to upcoming retirements and anticipated vacancies; and,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) if needed, consults with external advisors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee seeks a balanced representation of core competencies important to the Boards oversight role for the long-term success of Newfields business strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee endeavors to find candidates of high integrity who have a solid reputation and record of accomplishment in their chosen fields and who display the independence of mind and strength of character to effectively represent the best interests of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee Considers Experience  in the Following Areas:

sentences.text: Director Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee has nominated the nine people named below for election as directors at our Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies cannot be voted for more than nine nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If elected, each nominee below will serve as a director until our 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders and thereafter until a successor has been elected and qualified, or, if earlier, until the directors death, resignation or removal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless instructions to the contrary are given, all properly delivered proxies will be voted for the election of these nine nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Bylaws require that each director receive a majority of the votes cast with respect to such director in uncontested elections, meaning that the number of shares voted FOR a director nominee must exceed the number of votes cast AGAINST that nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of this years director nominees currently serve on our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If our stockholders do not re-elect a nominee who already is serving as a director, Delaware law provides that the director would continue to serve on the Board as a holdover director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Bylaws, holdover directors must submit an irrevocable resignation in writing to the Chair of the Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee must make a recommendation to our Board regarding whether to accept or reject the resignation, or whether other action should be taken.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board would then act on the Governance Committees recommendation and publicly disclose its decision (including if the resignation is rejected, the rationale behind it) within 90 days of the date the election results were certified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any nominee is unable or unwilling to serve, the proxy holders will vote for such other person as may be nominated by the Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, our Board may reduce the size of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have no reason to believe that any of the nominees will be unable or unwilling to serve if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Composition of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is a collection of individuals with a variety of complementary skills derived from their diverse backgrounds and experiences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our director ominees currently serve on our Board, and our Board has determined that each of our nominees, other than Mr. Boothby, is independent.

sentences.text: LEE K. BOOTHBY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MR. BOOTHBY is our Chairman, President and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was promoted to the position of President in February 2009 and to the additional role of CEO three months later.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From October 2007 until February 2009, Mr. Boothby served as our Senior Vice President  Acquisitions & Business Development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Set forth below is a discussion about our corporate governance policies and practices as well as other matters relating to our Board and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is responsible for, and believes in, overseeing Newfields assets and business affairs in an honest, fair, diligent and ethical manner driven by best corporate governance principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To fulfill its responsibilities, the Board follows the procedures and standards set forth in its Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These Guidelines address matters such as:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director responsibilities and conduct;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman and Lead Director responsibilities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director qualifications;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board composition;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board and committee functions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director access to officers, employees and advisors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director compensation and stock ownership;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board interaction with investors and the media;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director orientation and continuing education;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: evaluation of our President and CEO;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: management succession;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board communications; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reports concerning accounting and performance evaluations of our Board and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Access Nominations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, the Board approved an amendment to our Bylaws to allow a stockholder or group of stockholders that meet certain criteria and requirements to nominate candidates for election to the Board and have such candidates included in our proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, Article II, Section 2.13(e) has been added to our Bylaws to permit a stockholder, or a group of up to 20 stockholders, owning 3% or more of our outstanding common stock continuously for at least three years to nominate and include in our proxy materials directors constituting up to the greater of 20% of the Board or two directors, provided that the stockholder(s) and the nominee(s) satisfy the requirements specified in the Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to utilize proxy access, you must submit the information required under the Bylaws to us not later than the close of business on the 120th day, nor earlier than the close of business on the 150th day, prior to the first anniversary of the date the definitive proxy statement was first sent to stockholders in connection with the preceding years annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, for the 2018 Annual Meeting, such notice must be received no earlier than October 30, 2017 and no later than November 29, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any questions regarding our proxy access procedures may be directed to our Corporate Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Recommendations of Director Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, the Governance Committee will use the same process to evaluate candidates recommended by stockholders as it uses to evaluate all other director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if a candidate is recommended by a stockholder or a group of stockholders, the Governance Committee also will review the information required of such nominees pursuant to Newfields Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you want the Governance Committee to consider a possible candidate for director, you should submit the name of the candidate, together with appropriate biographical information, to the Chair of the Governance Committee, c/o Corporate Secretary, Newfield Exploration Company, 4 Waterway Square Place, Suite 100, The Woodlands, Texas 77380.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to propose a matter for action at a stockholders meeting, including the nomination of a director for election, you must comply with the provisions of our Bylaws that are described in this Proxy Statement in the section entitled Stockholder Proposals for 2018 Annual Meeting and Director Nominations on page 73.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diversity Policy for Director Candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Director Selection Process and Guidelines do not prescribe specific standards for diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, in selecting director candidates, the Governance Committee and the Board take diversity into account, seeking to ensure a representation of varied perspectives and experiences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through its succession-planning process, which occurs at least annually, the Governance Committee reviews the skills and elements of diversity for all directors to ensure that the Board members represent the appropriate and relevant skills, perspectives and experiences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfield Exploration Company  2017 PROXY STATEMENT    16
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has determined that eight of our nine nominated directors are independent as defined by NYSE rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making this determination, the Board considered various transactions and relationships between each director nominee or his or her immediate family and Newfield and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of this review was to determine whether any such relationships or transactions were material and, therefore, inconsistent with a determination that the director is independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the ordinary course of business during 2016, we entered into purchase and sale transactions for products and services with certain companies affiliated with members of our Board of Directors, as described below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schanck is a director of P2 Energy Solutions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we paid P2 Energy Solutions approximately $2.1 million in licensing agreement and annual maintenance costs for software.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Nance was a director of The Williams Companies for a portion of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we paid The Williams Companies approximately $2.2 million for lease payments for our office space in Tulsa, Oklahoma and $0.2 million for a joint interest billing credit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally expect transactions of a similar nature to occur during 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See also Related Person Transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of its review, our Board affirmatively determined, based on its understanding of such transactions and relationships, that all of the nominees for director are independent of Newfield under the standards set forth by the NYSE, with the exception of Lee Boothby, our Chairman of the Board, President and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no family relationships between any of the nominees for director or between any nominee and any executive officer of Newfield.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have a policy with respect to separating the roles of Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee and the other independent members of our Board annually evaluate the appropriate leadership structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lee K. Boothby, our President and CEO, has served as our Chairman since May 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes a combined Chairman/CEO office provides significant benefits for our stockholders, including a unified approach to strategy and execution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that a Chairman who understands Newfields day-to-day business and the important issues to be addressed by the Board ensures that the Board has valuable insight into operations and strategies from managements perspective and facilitates the flow of information between management and the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also believes a combined Chairman/CEO leadership structure ensures the appropriate level of independent oversight because:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Board has an independent Lead Director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Lead Director collaborates with the Chairman to set the agenda for each meeting of the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board committees are composed entirely of independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the independent Compensation & Management Development Committee (Compensation Committee) annually evaluates the performance of our President and CEO; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: all of the director nominees, other than Mr. Boothby, our Chairman, President and CEO, are independent under the standards set forth by the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman ensures the overall effectiveness of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairmans significant responsibilities are to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: set Board meeting agendas, in collaboration with the Lead Director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: preside over meetings of the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serve as a liaison between the Board and management; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: chair the Annual Meeting of Stockholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Steven W. Nance has served as our Lead Director since May 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director is an independent director nominated by the Governance Committee and is elected by the Board for a one-year term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director serves a valuable role in leading the Board and creating an atmosphere in which the Board can enhance Newfields success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Directors significant responsibilities are to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: act as a liaison between the independent directors and the Chairman/CEO and management, including with regard to the interest of the independent directors in having particular issues or topics addressed in a Board meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: collaborate with the Chairman/CEO on the agendas for the meetings of the Board (including schedule and materials);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: set the agendas for, call for, and preside over the executive sessions of the independent directors, which typically are conducted at each Board meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: brief the Chairman/CEO and management, as needed, on the issues discussed in the executive sessions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: preside over meetings of the Board when the Chairman is not present or has a conflict;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serve as a mentor and provide guidance to the Chairman/CEO as requested or needed;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: coordinate the retention of consultants and advisors who report directly to the Board on Board matters (as opposed to committee consultants and advisors);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: facilitate and assist the Governance Committee with Board, committee and director evaluations, and communicate results;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assist the Chairman/CEO and Chair of the Compensation Committee with succession planning, as necessary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: foster a respectful atmosphere in which directors feel comfortable asking questions, providing insight and engaging in dialogue;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: frequently meet with management to preview significant matters (such as potential acquisitions and other large capital commitments) expected to be presented to the Board, and act as a general resource to the Chairman/CEO; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: as needed or requested by the Board, perform other corporate governance duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfield Exploration Company  2017 PROXY STATEMENT    17
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance Policies and Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Sessions of Independent Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our non-employee directors are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that our independent directors will meet in executive session at least annually, and more frequently as needed at the call of one or more independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In practice, our independent directors meet in executive session on a regular basis  usually at each regularly scheduled meeting of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These executive sessions are presided over by the Lead Director or, if the Lead Director is not in attendance, by another person chosen by the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is responsible for implementing our financial and business strategies, and for assessing and managing the risks relating to Newfield and its performance under those strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board reviews, approves (where appropriate) and monitors our financial and business objectives, strategies, plans and major corporate actions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board also assesses major risks relating to Newfield and its performance, and reviews options to mitigate and address such risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board retains primary responsibility to oversee risks related to our strategy and business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist the Board in discharging its oversight responsibilities, members of management report to the Board and its committees on areas of risk to Newfield, and our Board committees consider specific areas of risk inherent in their respective spheres of oversight and report to the full Board on these matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our Audit Committee discusses with management our major financial risk exposures and the steps management has taken to monitor and control such exposures;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our Compensation Committee incorporates risk considerations, including the risk of loss of key personnel, as it evaluates the performance of our President and CEO and other executive officers, reviews management development and succession plans, and considers risks related to our compensation programs and policies;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our Governance Committee focuses on issues relating to Board composition, leadership structures and corporate governance matters; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our Operations & Reserves Committee reviews, evaluates and oversees Newfields risks relating to our operations, including matters relating to safety, the environment, regulations, compliance and reserves.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to receiving reports from Board committees regarding the risks considered in their respective areas, at least once a year, the Board will specifically review our long-term strategic plans and the principal issues and risks we may face, as well as the processes through which we manage risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This ensures our Board has a broad view of our strategy and overall risk management process and enables the full Board to coordinate risk oversight, especially with respect to risk interrelationships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our combined Chairman/CEO role enhances the Boards administration of its risk oversight function because, through his role as Chairman, our President and CEO is able to provide the Board with valuable insight into our risk profile and the options to mitigate and address our risks based on his experiences with the daily management of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mandatory Retirement Age for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any director who reaches age 72 while in office must resign at the end of the current term, unless
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the members of the Governance Committee unanimously (not including the director in question if such director is a member of the Governance Committee) waive such requirement due to special circumstances, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) such waiver is ratified and approved by a majority of the disinterested directors on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, J. Terry Strange reached our mandatory retirement age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee determined it was prudent to waive Mr. Stranges mandatory retirement for one year in 2016 and again for one year in 2017, and that waiver was ratified and approved unanimously by the disinterested directors of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Term Limits for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The oil and gas industry is very specialized and takes years to truly understand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes Newfield and its stockholders benefit from Board continuity and stability that allows directors to focus on long-term business strategies and results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For these reasons, among others, the Board does not believe it should establish arbitrary term limits for directors based on years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such term limits would likely cause us to lose the contributions of directors who have developed significant and valuable insight into Newfield, its operations and industry that would be difficult to replace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes it is important to align director interests with those of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All independent directors are expected to own Newfield stock equal in value to five times their annual cash retainer, not including any cash retainers paid to a director for serving as the Lead Director or a chair of a committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such ownership must be reached within five years from a directors first appointment to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of year-end 2016, all independent directors met our stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfield Exploration Company  2017 PROXY STATEMENT    18
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communication with Independent Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have established an Ethics Line, which enables investors, employees and any other interested parties in any country in which we operate to anonymously report any practices thought to be in violation of our corporate governance policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Ethics Line also can be used to communicate with our independent directors, including our Lead Director, on a direct and confidential basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The web address for our Ethics Line is www.newfieldexploration.ethicspoint.com and the telephone number in the United States, Guam, Puerto Rico and Canada is 866-593-5936.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional information regarding the Ethics Line is available on our website at http://www.newfield.com under the tab Corporate Responsibility  Governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Attendance at Board and Committee Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board met in person or by telephone conference six times during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the directors attended 75% or more of the total number of meetings of the Board held in 2016 and the total number of meetings held in 2016 by all committees of the Board on which he or she served (during the periods that he or she served on such committee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Attendance at Annual Meetings of Stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are expected to attend the Annual Meetings of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our then current directors attended the 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board presently has four standing committees: Audit, Compensation & Management Development, Nominating & Corporate Governance, and Operations & Reserves.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of these committees is composed entirely of independent directors and operates under a governing charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Corporate Governance Documents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members (all independent): Thomas G. Ricks (Chair), Pamela J. Gardner, Roger B. Plank and J. Terry Strange
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings Held in 2016: 7
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE PRIMARY PURPOSES OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE ARE TO ASSIST THE BOARD IN MONITORING:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the integrity of our financial statements and financial reporting processes and systems of internal control;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the qualifications and independence of our independent auditors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the performance of our internal audit function and independent auditors; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also prepares a report each year in conformity with SEC regulations for inclusion in our Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for appointing, retaining and terminating our independent auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that each of Messrs. Ricks, Strange and Plank meets the qualifications of an audit committee financial expert, as defined by SEC regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Mr. Strange also serves on the audit committees of Group 1 Automotive, Inc., New Jersey Resources Corporation and BBVA Compass Bancshares, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has determined that such simultaneous service on these other audit committees and on our Audit Committee does not impair the ability of Mr. Strange to serve Newfield effectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfield Exploration Company  2017 PROXY STATEMENT    19
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation & Management Development Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members (all independent):  J. Terry Strange (Chair), Juanita M. Romans, John (Jack) W. Schanck and J.  Kent Wells
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings Held in 2016: 8
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE PRIMARY PURPOSES OF THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE ARE TO:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review, evaluate, modify and approve the compensation of our executive officers and other key employees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: produce a report on executive compensation each year for inclusion in our Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: oversee the evaluation and development of Newfield management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: oversee succession planning for our President and CEO and other officers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: perform such other functions as the Board may assign to the Compensation Committee from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has authority to oversee the administration of compensation programs applicable to all of our employees, including our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may delegate some or all of its authority to subcommittees when it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may also provide input on the structure of our non-employee director compensation program, as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No member of the Compensation Committee is or has been an officer of Newfield, was an employee of Newfield during the last fiscal year or as of the date of this Proxy Statement, or is serving or has served as a member of the compensation committee of another entity that has an executive officer serving on Newfields Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No executive officer of Newfield served as a director of another entity that had an executive officer serving as a Newfield director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members (all independent): Steven W. Nance (Chair), Pamela J. Gardner, Thomas G. Ricks and Juanita M. Romans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings Held in 2016: 4
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE PRIMARY PURPOSES OF THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE ARE TO:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: advise our Board about the appropriate composition of the Board and its committees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: evaluate potential or suggested director nominees and identify individuals qualified to be directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: nominate directors for election at our Annual Meetings of Stockholders or for appointment to fill vacancies;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recommend to our Board the directors to serve as members of each committee and the individual members to serve as chair of the committe
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approve the compensation structure for all non-employee directors (the Compensation Committee may also provide input on such structure, as appropriate);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: advise our Board about corporate governance practices, develop and recommend to the Board appropriate corporate governance practices and policies, and assist the Board in implementing those practices and policies;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: oversee the evaluation of our Board through an annual review of the performance of the Board and its committees; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: oversee the new director orientation program and the continuing education program for all directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operations & Reserves Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members (all independent): John (Jack) W. Schanck (Chair), Steven W. Nance, Roger B. Plank and J. Kent Wells
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings Held in 2016: 6
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE PRIMARY PURPOSES OF THE OPERATIONS COMMITTEE ARE TO:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review, evaluate and oversee Newfields operations, including matters relating to safety, the environment, regulations, and compliance, and the analysis and reporting of Newfields proved reserves;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review, evaluate and discuss future projects;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review, evaluate and discuss the risks related to Newfields day-to-day operations; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: perform such other functions as the Board may assign to the Operations & Reserves Committee from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfield Exploration Company  2017 PROXY STATEMENT    20
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related Person Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we have not formally adopted written policies or procedures for the approval of related person transactions, our Corporate Governance Guidelines and Code of Business Conduct and Ethics (Code of Conduct), which applies to all employees, executive officers and directors, specifically prohibit conflicts of interest, except under guidelines approved by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Code of Conduct, a conflict of interest is defined as any circumstance that could impair a persons ability to act with complete objectivity with regard to Newfields interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any employee or director who becomes aware of a conflict or potential conflict is asked to bring it to the attention of a supervisor, management or other appropriate personnel, who then is required to document and report the outcome of such matters to our compliance officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Board must resolve any conflict of interest question involving the President and CEO or any executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Corporate Governance Guidelines state that directors must attempt to avoid any situation that may give rise to a conflict of interest or the appearance of a conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an actual or potential conflict of interest arises, the director must promptly inform the Chairman of the Board and the Chair of the Governance Committee (or in the event a potential conflict arises with the Chair of the Governance Committee, that individual must notify the Chair of the Audit Committee) and recuse himself or herself from any Board deliberations or decisions related to the matter that is the subject of the conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an actual or potential conflict exists and cannot be resolved by a directors recusal from participation in discussions or deliberations related to the matter or in any other reasonable manner, the director is expected to offer to tender a resignation to the Chair of the Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee will determine whether to accept or reject such offer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the Governance Committee and our Board annually review related person transactions with respect to directors (including those transactions described above under Corporate Governance  Director Independence on page 17) as part of their annual assessment of director independence and the director nomination process, as provided in our Corporate Governance Guidelines and the written charter of our Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other related person transactions are disclosed to our Board or a Board committee and are addressed on a case by case basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Codes and Corporate Governance Documents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, Financial Code of Ethics and Insider Trading Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has formally adopted, and annually reviews and approves, a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics governing the conduct and decisions of our directors, officers and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Board has adopted, and annually reviews and approves, our Financial Code of Ethics applicable to our President and CEO, Chief Financial Officer and Controller or Chief Accounting Officer, and our Insider Trading Policy applicable to each Newfield director, officer, employee and consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Documents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Guidelines and Codes mentioned above, as well as the charters for the Boards four standing committees, are available on our website at http://www.newfield.com under the tab Corporate Responsibility  Governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfield Exploration Company  2017 PROXY STATEMENT    21
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only non-employee directors are compensated for serving as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, Mr. Boothby, our Chairman, President and CEO, is the only Board member who is a Newfield employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His compensation is included in the Summary Compensation Table of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee has the sole authority to approve the compensation structure for all non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may also provide input on the structure of our non-employee director compensation program, as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director compensation is reviewed at least annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee seeks to set director compensation at an adequate level to compensate directors for their time and effort expended in satisfying their obligations without jeopardizing their independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, the Governance Committee considered the compensation of the non-employee directors, seeking the input of the Compensation Committee as appropriate, and Pearl Meyer provided a report on director compensation to the Governance Committee for use in its consideration of 2016/2017 director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on these considerations, the Governance Committee determined that no changes were necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, compensation for non- employee directors for the 2016/2017 period was as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation for 2015/2016 ($)   Compensation for 2016/2017 ($) Annual cash retainer   $ 75,000   No change Annual fee for chair of the Governance Committee     20,000   No change Annual fee for chair of the Audit Committee     25,000   No change Annual fee for chair of the Compensation Committee     20,000   No change Annual fee for chair of the Operations & Reserves Committee     20,000   No change Annual fee for Lead Director     75,000   No change Annual equity award (in the form of restricted stock or restricted stock units)     200,000   No change
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual equity awards were granted in 2016 pursuant to the Newfield Exploration Company 2011 Omnibus Stock Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning with the 2016 grants, our non-employee directors were given the opportunity to elect to defer the settlement date of their annual equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director who is in office immediately after an Annual Meeting of Stockholders and who does not elect to defer the equity award pursuant to the Newfield Exploration Company Non-Employee Directors Deferred Compensation Plan will be granted restricted shares with a specified market value (which was approximately $200,000 for 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of restricted shares granted is determined by dividing that market value by the average of the high and low sales prices of Newfield common stock on the date of the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, the restrictions on the shares granted will lapse on the day before the first Annual Meeting of Stockholders after the date of grant if the director is still on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if a non-employee director terminates service as a director by reason of death or disability, the restrictions on the award will lapse as of the date of termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any non-employee director who is in office immediately after an Annual Meeting of Stockholders and who elects to defer the award will be granted a number of restricted stock units calculated in the same manner as the restricted stock award described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These restricted stock units will be deposited in an account within the Newfield Exploration Company Non-Employee Directors Deferred Compensation Plan and will be subject to the same vesting terms described above for restricted stock awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distributions with respect to restricted stock units from such accounts will be made according to the particular directors instructions under the Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any non-employee director who is appointed by the Board not in connection with an Annual Meeting of Stockholders will be granted restricted shares with the same market value as used for the previous Annual Meeting, pro-rated to reflect the actual time served on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such cases the number of restricted shares will be determined by dividing the pro-rated market value by the average of the high and low sales prices of Newfield common stock on the date of appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfield Exploration Company  2017 PROXY STATEMENT    22
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation & Management Development Committee of our Board (Compensation Committee) oversees our compensation programs for executive officers and all employees.

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) explains the Compensation Committees compensation philosophy, summarizes our executive compensation program and describes compensation decisions for Newfields Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and the three other most highly-compensated executive officers for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I.  Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfield is a large independent exploration and production company, which has successfully transitioned from a diversified asset base of U.S. and nternational onshore and offshore operations to a more focused portfolio of U.S. onshore liquids-rich plays with extensive drilling inventories.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through the sale of approximately $3 billion of non-strategic assets since 2011, we refocused Newfield on domestic large scale, liquids-rich resource plays.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our largest assets today are the SCOOP and STACK plays in Oklahomas Anadarko Basin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our transformation has contributed to our position as a leader in our sector in total stockholder return (TSR) over the past five years, which was driven in part by our superior performance in the past three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Stockholder Return (TSR) Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following a five-year period (2010-2014) of exceptional strength and consistency, crude oil prices began collapsing in late 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The price of oil (NYMEX WTI) reached a low of approximately $26 per barrel in February 2016, as compared to approximately $107 per barrel in mid-2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Natural gas prices also experienced significant declines in 2014-2016, as the NYMEX Henry Hub natural gas price during that period ranged from a high of approximately $6.15 per MMBtu in February 2014 to a low of approximately $1.64 per MMBtu in March 2016 (the lowest price since February 1999).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Despite these significant challenges, we excelled on TSR performance over the past three years versus a group of our peers in the E&P industry that we are likely to be compared against (the E&P Peer Group).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our strong balance sheet, operational execution, timely acquisitions and divestitures and the continued positive results in SCOOP and STACK have helped to differentiate our story from our peers in the E&P Peer Group during this period of commodity price downturn.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we had a gain in TSR of approximately 64% over the past three years ending December 31, 2016, versus an average decline of approximately 25% in the E&P Peer Group in the same period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Relative TSR Performance  3 Year chart below compares our TSR to the E&P Peer Group and highlights our exceptional performance over the past three years:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Business Strategy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our efforts to refine our asset base and better focus our investments on oil and liquids-rich onshore resource plays in the U.S. are consistent with our long- term business strategy of creating lasting stockholder value through the consistent growth of cash flow, production and proved reserves.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Today, our primary growth area is the Anadarko Basin of Oklahoma where we have an extensive inventory of drilling locations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCOOP and STACK are characterized by wells with strong production rates, high initial oil cuts and low operating expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our business strategy includes the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preserving financial strength
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Focusing on organic growth opportunities through disciplined capital investments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: High-grade investments based on rate of return
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuously improving operations and returns
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executing select, strategic acquisitions and divestitures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attracting and retaining quality employees who are aligned with stockholder interests
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfield Exploration Company  2017 PROXY STATEMENT    26
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since the oil price collapse of late 2014, Newfield has made significant adjustments to capital investments, operating plans and cost structures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over this two- year period, we took significant and proactive steps to preserve liquidity, ensure financial strength and maintain operational momentum in our SCOOP and STACK plays.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Operating costs exclude DD&A, ceiling test impairments, firm gas transportation and oil and gas delivery shortfall fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enhance corporate performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Improve operational & organizational efficiencies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maintain financial health
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Demonstrate corporate responsibility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Direct Compensation Components
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In support of our compensation philosophy and objectives (page 29), total 2016 direct compensation received by our NEOs is comprised of the elements included in the chart below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indirect compensation (such as retirement benefits and perquisites) is discussed under  2016 Compensation Decisions  Other Compensation beginning on page 38.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OVERVIEW OF EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PROGRAM FOR 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reward Element  Form   Purpose   Valuation Parameters FIXED  Base Salary  Cash    Provide market competitive level of fixed  compensation  for  the fundamental duties required of the position to attract and retain talent    Compensates executive officers for their level of responsibility, skills, capabilities, experience and leadership AT RISK  Annual Incentive Awards  Cash    Motivate  and  reward  performance achievement against stated annual Company and individual goals    Measures Company performance on five operational measures (75%) in combination with strategic priorities (25%) and includes an individual performance assessment         Additionally  reward  performance compared to our strategic priorities     Long-Term Equity-Based Compensation  Time-based RSUs (50% cash-settled and 50% stock-settled)   Performance-based RSUs (relative TSR)   Reward  creation  of  long-term stockholder value and achievements consistent with our long-term business strategies   Builds a consistent ownership stake in Newfield that aligns the interests of executive officers and stockholders          Time-based RSUs have a three-year continued service vesting requirement that provides a retention incentive       Align NEO compensation with changes in stockholder value   Performance-based RSUs motivate consistent improvement in long-term stockholder value to further align executive and stockholder interests, with the number of shares ultimately received dependent upon relative TSR performance against companies in the TSR Performance Peer Group over a three-year period             Grants to CEO, CFO and COO are split 50 (time-based)/50 (performance-based), while grants to the other NEOs are split 60 (time-based)/40 (performance-based)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfield Exploration Company  2017 PROXY STATEMENT    27
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the last several years, the Compensation Committee has shifted more NEO total direct compensation towards variable at risk components (annual ncentive awards and long-term equity-based incentive awards), where actual amounts earned may differ from target amounts based on Company and ndividual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we have improved alignment of our executive compensation with our near- and long-term business strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that a program weighted towards variable, at-risk compensation helps align NEO and stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charts below illustrate the approximate mix of 2016 target total direct compensation for our CEO and other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charts above are based on 2016 base salaries, target bonus amounts with respect to 2016 annual incentive awards, and the award guideline value for the 2016 grants of time- and performance-based restricted stock units (RSUs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts actually realized by our NEOs with respect to the annual incentive awards and RSUs depend on a variety of factors including the level of attainment of the relevant performance goals and the value of our common stock when he RSUs vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key 2016 Executive Compensation Actions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in more detail throughout this CD&A, our executive compensation program and actions delivered outcomes aligned with our solid operational, financial and strategic performance in 2016 and current market conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee elected not to increase base salaries for the NEOs for the 2016 year, except for limited increases for Messrs. Massaro and Dunn.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See 2016 Compensation Decisions  Base Salary on page 33.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee adjusted certain performance measures under our annual 2016 incentive award program to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1) emphasize near-term and relative operational performance measures and focus on the near-term goal of controlling cash expenses; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2) drive capital efficiency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to our outstanding results for 2016, the Compensation Committee approved a collective 2016 annual incentive award payout factor (AIP Factor) of 1.75 or 175% with respect to the overall Company performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See 2016 Compensation Decisions  Annual Incentive Awards on page 33.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Equity-Based Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee granted performance-based RSUs constituting 50% of the total long-term equity-based incentive award value granted to our CEO, CFO and COO and 40% of the total long-term equity-based incentive award value granted to our other NEOs for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards are earned based on Newfields relative TSR compared to the TSR Performance Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to better align executive officer compensation with stockholder interests, to provide a greater upside incentive to management and to motivate management to increase Company performance, the Compensation Committee redesigned certain aspects of the performance-based RSUs granted in 2016 to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: replace the two- to three-year performance period with a single three-year performance period;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: replace the quarterly vesting opportunities with a single vesting opportunity at the end of the three-year performance period; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: award a target number of performance-based RSUs, with the final number of shares earned ranging from 0% to 200% of the target level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also increased the long-term equity-based incentive award guidelines for the NEOs so that a greater proportion of total NEO compensation is variable or at risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See 2016 Compensation Decisions  Long-Term Equity-Based Incentive Awards on page 37.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to previously granted performance-based RSUs, the NEOs earned 5%, 0%, 100% and 100% of the performance-based RSUs granted in 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014, respectively, in 2016 based on Newfields relative TSR performance against the applicable peer group of companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Executive Compensation PhilosophyPay for Performance beginning on page 30.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Outreach
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the last year, we continued our outreach efforts to stockholders to maintain an ongoing dialogue and solicited feedback on our executive compensation program, corporate governance, safety and environmental programs, corporate responsibility and other important issues to our owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we invited stockholders representing approximately 61% of our outstanding common stock to speak with us regarding our compensation, corporate governance and corporate responsibility practices, two of whom accepted our invitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board and its relevant committees discussed this constructive feedback and it was used to further strengthen our compensation programs, improve our disclosure practices, and address other governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfield Exploration Company  2017 PROXY STATEMENT    28
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee values the insights we glean from our stockholder outreach and from our annual say-on-pay advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, approximately 98% of the total votes cast were in favor of our say-on-pay proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although this vote demonstrates resounding approval of our executive compensation program, the Compensation Committee continues to carefully review our executive pay programs and encourages management to continue its stockholder engagement efforts to ensure continued stockholder support.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: II.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Philosophy and Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation philosophy is guided by the following objectives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Goal-Oriented Pay for Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cornerstone of our compensation program is pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making compensation decisions, we focus on Newfields annual and long-term performanceboth on an absolute basis and in relation to our peersas well as the individual performance of our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitive Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes it is imperative to maintain market-competitive compensation programs to attract, retain and motivate executives and our future leaders that are in line with the compensation of similar executive positions at peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alignment with Long-Term Stockholder Interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By providing a significant portion of compensation in the form of long-term equity-based incentive awards, including time-based and performance-based RSUs, we closely align the interests of our executives and stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our core executive compensation practices are summarized below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Practices We Follow     Practices We Prohibit We structure our compensation so that approximately 88% of our CEOs, approximately 86% of our CFOs and COOs and approximately 80% of our other NEOs total direct compensation is at risk   We do not have employment agreements with any of our executive officers We tie our annual incentive awards to a range of objective and strategic measurements   We do not provide for excise tax gross-ups in connection with a change of control in any executive officer agreements entered into after January 2009, and it is our policy not to include any such tax gross-up in any future executive officer agreements We emphasize long-term performance in our equity-based incentive awards   We prohibit executive officers from buying, selling or writing puts, calls or options related to Newfield stock 50% of long-term incentive awards for our CEO, CFO and COO and 40% of our other NEOs long-term incentive awards are performance- based RSUs   We prohibit executives from holding Newfield stock in a margin account or pledging it as collateral We use two representative and relevant peer groups, our Compensation Peer Group and TSR Performance Peer Group   We do not allow repricing of stock options without stockholder approval Our change of control severance agreements are double-trigger, requiring both a change of control and a loss of position before any cash payments are awarded   We do not grant excessive perquisites, and all perquisites have a specific business rationale We mandate stock ownership requirements for our officers and directors      Our Compensation Committee is made up solely of independent directors and engages an independent compensation consultant       We hold an annual say-on-pay advisory vote       We consider tax deductibility when structuring compensation       Our clawback policy enables us to seek to recover equity and cash incentive awards inappropriately received by an executive officer       Our equity compensation plan includes minimum vesting or forfeiture requirements of at least one year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfield Exploration Company  2017 PROXY STATEMENT    29
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Back to Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Linking our Compensation Philosophy to Performance and Pay Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our executive compensation program plays an important role in helping us achieve our business objectives and effectively rewards our executive officers for their contributions to those achievements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart below illustrates the link between our compensation philosophy with respect to each element of our compensation program, our performance and our specific pay decisions for our CEO for 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NFX CEO Pay vs. 2016 Compensation Peers CEO Pay Percentile Rank   2016 CEO Compensation  Philosophy   Summary of Relevant Performance Considerations   2016 Compensation Committee Action Base Salary   27th    Target 50th  Provide Competitive Compensation    Although Newfields overall performance in 2015 was strong, uncertain 2016 industry outlook    No base salary increase for CEO despite below-median base salary level Annual Incentive Awards   88th (Actual Payout)    Target: 50th  Goal-Oriented Pay for Performance      Although Newfields overall performance in 2015 was strong, uncertain 2016 industry outlook  Company performance on four of five operational measures was achieved above target level (with three measures exceeding the stretch goals); performance assessment for strategic priorities determined to fall between target and stretch levels    No increase in CEOs target bonus percentage despite below-median target level  Collective annual incentive award payout factor (AIP Factor) of 1.75 (175%) approved for overall Company performance measures (including both operational measures and strategic priorities) Long-Term Equity-Based Compensation   54th    Target: 50th to 75th  Goal-Oriented Pay for Performance  Alignment with Long-Term Stockholder Interests      Strong overall Company performance in 2015  Total stockholder return of approximately 64% over the past three years versus an average decline of approximately 25% in the E&P Peer Group in the same period  Stock price increase of approximately 24% during fiscal year 2016      2016 awards to CEO were split 50% time-based RSUs and 50% performance-based RSUs  Due to freeze in base salary level and target annual incentive award opportunity, increased the long-term equity-based incentive award guideline for the CEO so that a greater proportion of total compensation is variable or at-risk  Redesigned certain aspects of the 2016 performance-based RSUs to strengthen long-term focus and motivate increased stockholder value  Portions of performance-based RSUs granted in 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 were earned in 2016 at 5%, 0%, 100% and 100%, respectively

sentences.text: Pay for Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As illustrated above, the target total direct compensation of our NEOs is heavily weighted towards variable, at-risk compensation that is tied to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the actual amounts realized or realizable at a given time often differ from the amounts reported in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that realized compensation is more representative of compensation actually earned for a given year than the compensation reported in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of our strong operational and strategic performance in 2016 (our stock price increased approximately 24% during the year), our CEO earned 175% of his target bonus amount under his annual incentive award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, as a result of our stock price and our relative TSR performance, the actual realized value of our RSU awards as of December 31, 2016, was more than the CEOs target grant opportunity, which reinforces the programs alignment with stockholder interests and Company performance.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variances in the amount of direct compensation awarded to the NEOs generally reflect corporate performance and differences in individual responsibility and experience, as well as the compensation levels provided to officers in comparable positions in our 2016 Compensation Peer Group.

sentences.text: Peer Groups
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfield maintains a Compensation Peer Group and a TSR Performance Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout this CD&A we reference different peer groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed above, the E&P Peer Group represents a group of our peers in the E&P industry that we are likely to be compared against.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Peer Group and TSR Performance Peer Group are described in greater detail below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newfields successful execution of its strategic plan over the past few years has elevated our competitive position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the continued transformation of Newfields financial strength, operational characteristics, size and scope, the Compensation Committee requested a comprehensive review and analysis of the two peer groups maintained by Newfield for purposes of compensation and TSR performance for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee refers to data regarding compensation awarded to similarly-situated officers by companies in the Compensation Peer Group to ensure that our NEOs base salaries, target annual incentive award opportunities and equity grants are competitive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Peer Group is intended to reflect North American, onshore E&P companies that compete with Newfield for executive talent and have comparable activity/scope of operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This group was developed taking into consideration metrics including market capitalization, enterprise value nvestment strategy, earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA), leverage and liquidity, production, capital budget, comparability of asset portfolio and the availability of compensation data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The composition of this peer group is reviewed periodically.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, due to changes to Newfields size and scope, and in order for Newfield to rank at or close to the median of the Compensation Peer Group with respect to critical metrics, the Compensation Committee removed six companies (Cabot Oil & Gas Corp., Denbury Resources Inc., Laredo Petroleum Inc., Oasis Petroleum Inc., SandRidge Energy Inc., and Ultra Petroleum Corp.) that had been included in the 2015 Compensation Peer Group, and added four companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Compensation Peer Group consisted of the following companies:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
